text: The <extra_id_0> Tpl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> kinase activates the nuclear factor of activated T cells ( NFAT ) and induces <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in T-cell lines .

text: Here we show that the activation of the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter by <extra_id_0> Tpl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is inhibited by mutant signaling molecules that inhibit the mitogen - activated protein kinase ( MAPK ) or the calcineurin / NFAT pathways and is promoted by combinations of signaling molecules that activate these pathways .

text: We , therefore , conclude that signals generated by the convergence of the MAPK and the calcineurin / NFAT pathway are necessary and sufficient for the activation of the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter by <extra_id_0> Tpl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: The activation of both the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter and an NFAT - driven minimal promoter were shown to depend on signals transduced by <extra_id_0> Raf1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: However , it was only the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter whose activation by <extra_id_0> Tpl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was fully blocked by the dominant negative mutant MEK1S218 / 222A and the <extra_id_0> MEK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> MEK2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibitor PD098059 .

text: Since the activation of NFAT is MAPK - dependent these findings suggested that the activation of MAPK by <extra_id_0> Tpl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is either independent or only partially dependent on <extra_id_0> MEK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> MEK2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

In addition , they suggested that the activation of the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter is under the control of not only NFAT but also a second factor whose activation is MEK - dependent .

text: Experiments in COS-1 and EL-4 cells confirmed both hypotheses and revealed that the second factor activated by <extra_id_0> Tpl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is NF-kappaB .

While the activation of the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter and an NFAT - driven minimal promoter by <extra_id_0> Tpl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was fully blocked by the dominant negative mutant NFAT delta418 , it was only partially blocked by the calcineurin inhibitor cyclosporin A suggesting that the <extra_id_0> Tpl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated NFAT activation is under the control of a combination of calcineurin - dependent and independent pathways .
